intro: Galium himalayense, commonly known as Himalayan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
